Pre-Game Insights: New Zealand have never lost a World Cup game - ODI or T20I - against an Associate nation in their history.
New Zealand opted for just three frontline bowlers, four part-timers and no Ish Sodhi in their opening match against England.
Gary Stead is confident Kane Williamson will soon feature in the World Cup.
New Zealand are likely to have Tim Southee and Lockie Ferguson available for the match.
Team news: New Zealand's batting line-up is likely to remain the same with Rachin Ravindra slotted in at No. 3 and Will Young to retain his place at the top.
There is an injury cloud over Logan van Beek - he is struggling with a hamstring injury.
Pitch and conditions: The Hyderabad surface has historically been a high-scoring one with an average first-innings score of 288.
The temperature should revolve around the mid-30s in the afternoon while the evenings will be slightly cooler. There are no chances of rain.
Stats and trivia: Devon Conway has scored 307 runs in four ODI innings in India.
Matt Henry has picked up the most wickets for New Zealand in ODIs since the start of 2022 - 35 in 21 innings at 26.20.
Max O'Dowd and Vikramjit Singh are one and two in Netherlands' run-charts in ODIs this year.
